trans-unit.source: Represents a control primitive that handles the positioning and sizing of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control and two <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> controls that are used to set a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control does not have a default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>.

Its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> is implemented as part of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> controls.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> has a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb> control and two <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls that are used to change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control.
The following illustration shows a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> on a slider.
**A Track on a Slider**
![RepeatButton, Thumb](~/add/media/trackonslider.png "RepeatButton, Thumb")

The following table shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> properties and the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase> properties that they automatically bind to.
When either property changes, the bound property also changes.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> property
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase> property

The following table shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> properties and the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> properties to which they bind when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> properties are not explicitly set.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> property
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> property

The following table shows the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> properties and the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> properties to which they bind when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> properties are not explicitly set.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> property
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> property

Additionally, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> properties for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control bind with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> properties for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is used to scroll content, the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control is proportional to the percentage of the content that appears in the viewable area or viewport.
The following illustration shows an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control that implements a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control.
**A ScrollBar that has a Track control**
![ScrollBar illlustration](~/add/media/scrollbargeneric.png "ScrollBar illlustration")
The following calculation is used to compute the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A>.
thumbSize = (viewportSize/(maximum–minimum+viewportSize))×trackLength
The viewportSize parameter is the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property.
The maximum and minimum parameters correspond to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Minimum%2A> property values.
The value of the expression maximum–minimum+viewportSize is the size of the scrollable content.

Note that the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> property represents the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> when the content is scrolled to the bottom.
This <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> value is not the same as the length or extent of the content.
For a more detailed explanation, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> increases from top to bottom or from left to right depending on the orientation of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar>.

Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> increases from bottom to top or from left to right depending on the orientation of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider>.
To change the direction of increasing value, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> to `true`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> class.
Creates the layout for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The area that is provided for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> to use for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> content.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> that decreases the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control is in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> bind to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> that reduces the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> control when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> is pressed.
The default is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> control that has default settings.
Gets the child of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> at the specified index.

You specify the child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.DecreaseRepeatButton%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IncreaseRepeatButton%2A> properties.
The child elements are indexed in the order that the properties are set.
The index of the child.
Returns the object of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> at the specified index in the list of visual child elements.
The index must be a number between zero (0) and the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.VisualChildrenCount"></xref> property minus one (1).
The specified index is greater than the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.VisualChildrenCount"></xref> property minus one (1).

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> that increases the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> class.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control is in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton> controls of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> bind to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton.Delay%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> that increases the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> control when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> is pressed.
The default is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RepeatButton"></xref> control that has default settings.
Gets or sets whether the direction of increasing <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> is reversed from the default direction.

When the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A> is set to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.DecreaseRepeatButton%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IncreaseRepeatButton%2A> in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> exchange places.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> values increase from left to right for both horizontal <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> controls.

However, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> values for a vertical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> increase from top to bottom, whereas for a vertical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> these values increase from bottom to top.
When you set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A> property to `true`, the direction of increasing value reverses.

If you implement a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control and you do not explicitly set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property binds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.IsDirectionReversed%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IncreaseRepeatButton"></xref> and the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.DecreaseRepeatButton"></xref> exchanged positions and the direction of increasing value is reversed; otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IsDirectionReversed%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the maximum possible <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control is in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase> control and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not explicitly set, this property automatically binds with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> value for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control is equivalent to the size of the scrollable content minus the size of the visible content area or viewport.

For example, if the size of the content is 100 and the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property is 30, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> property is 70.

This is true because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control corresponds to the position in the scrollable content that appears at the top of the viewport.
When the content is scrolled to the very bottom in this example, 30 percent of the content still appears in the viewport.

Therefore, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> that corresponds to the top of the viewport is 70, and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> value is 70.

The following illustration shows how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> corresponds to a position in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer> control.
![Value corresponds to the position of the content](~/add/media/scrollbarvalueeqmaximum.png "Value corresponds to the position of the content")
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The largest allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The default is 1.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> dependency property.
Measures the layout size that is required for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> and its components.
The size of the available space for the track.
The layout <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> that is required by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
Gets or sets the minimum possible <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control is in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase> control and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Minimum%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not explicitly set, this property automatically binds with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The smallest allowable <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Minimum"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Minimum%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> is displayed horizontally or vertically.

If you implement a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control and you do not explicitly set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation%2A> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property binds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

If you implement a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control and you do not explicitly set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation%2A> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property binds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider.Orientation%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`

An <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation"></xref> enumeration value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> is displayed horizontally or vertically.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Orientation%2A> dependency property.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control that is used to change the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.

The placement of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control.
The size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control reflects the amount of content that is currently visible.
The size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is computed in the following ways:
If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property is not specified, the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> is a fixed default value.
This is how the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> of a Track functions inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property is specified and the size of the content is greater than the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A>, the following formula is used:
ThumbSize = TrackLength * ViewportSize / (Maximum – Minimum + ViewportSize)
Where the parameters are defined as follows:
ThumbSize
The size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control in the same units as the TrackLength.
TrackLength
The length of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track>.
ViewportSize
The size of the scrollable area that is visible in the content units, such as the number of pages of a document.
Maximum
The maximum value of the content in content units, such as page 10 of a 10-page document.
Minimum
The minimum value of the content in content units, such as page 1 of a document.
The following illustration shows a visual representation of some of these parameters in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control.
![Viewport size, thumb size, and track length](~/add/media/scrollbarthumbsizemath.png "Viewport size, thumb size, and track length")

If the size of the content is less than a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A>, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> does not appear and the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Visibility%2A> property of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> is set to `false`.

The minimum sizes for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control are determined by two system parameters, <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VerticalScrollBarButtonHeight%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.HorizontalScrollBarThumbWidth%2A>.

The minimum size for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control in a vertical <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is 1/2 * <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.VerticalScrollBarButtonHeight%2A> and the minimum size for a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control in a horizontal <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> is 1/2 * <xref:System.Windows.SystemParameters.HorizontalScrollBarThumbWidth%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control that is used with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The default is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> control that has default settings.

Gets or sets the current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> as determined by the position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> represents a value that is between the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Maximum%2A> property values.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control is part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase> control and the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is not explicitly set, this property automatically binds with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.BindsTwoWayByDefault%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsArrange%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Journal%2A>
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The default is 0.

Calculates the change in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb"></xref> moves.
The horizontal displacement of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb"></xref>.
The vertical displacement of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb"></xref>.

The change in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> that corresponds to the displacement of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
Calculates the distance from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb"></xref> to a specified point along the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
The specified point.
The distance between the and the specified pt value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Value%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets the size of the part of the scrollable content that is visible.

The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property is used to calculate the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> is not <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information, see the remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> property.

To explicitly define the size of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Thumb>, create an object that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> class and provide overrides for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.MeasureOverride%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ArrangeOverride%2A>.

If you implement a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> as part of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar> control and you do not explicitly set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property binds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.ViewportSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> control that is implemented in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Slider> control is always <xref:System.Double.NaN?displayProperty=fullName>, because the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A> control does not change size.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The size of the visible area of the scrollable content.
The default is <xref href="System.Double.NaN"></xref>, which means that the content size is not defined.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.ViewportSize%2A> dependency property.
Gets the number of child elements of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.

You specify the child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.Thumb%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.DecreaseRepeatButton%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track.IncreaseRepeatButton%2A> properties.
The child elements are indexed in the order that the properties are set.
An integer between 0 and 2 that specifies the number of child elements in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Track"></xref>.
